title: Rate law of NO2 from graphs

content.description: <math alttext="N O 2, gas, plus C O, gas, react to produce N O, gas, plus C O 2, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>NO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>CO</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mo>â†’</mo><mi>NO</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>CO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>
content.question: A group of students studied the rate of the reaction represented above at a fixed temperature. During the reaction, the concentration of <math alttext="C O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>CO</mi></math> was in large excess. The graphs shown below were created using the data collected by the students. Based on the graphs, which of the following is the rate law?

choices.label: <math alttext="Rate equals the molar concentration of N O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Rate</mi><mo>=</mo><mpadded><mo>[</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>NO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded></math>

<math alttext="Rate equals k, times, the molar concentration of N O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Rate</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mpadded><mo>[</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>NO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded></math>

<math alttext="Rate equals k, times, the molar concentration of N O 2, squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Rate</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><msup><mpadded><mo>[</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>NO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="Rate equals k, times, the molar concentration of N O 2, squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Rate</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><msup><mpadded><mo>[</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>NO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

skill.text: 5.D: Identify information presented graphically to solve a problem.
